children.value: This is a React equivalent of Mapbox's

, which can be used to
show tooltip popups with custom HTML content at specific locations on the map.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textlatitudecode number required permalink
code classlanguage textlongitudecode number required permalink

children.value: Offset of the anchor from the left in pixels, negative number indicates left.
Offset of the anchor from the top in pixels, negative number indicates up.
, a close button will appear in the top right corner of the popup.
, the popup will closed when the map is clicked.
Size of the tip pointing to the coordinate.

A string indicating the popup's position relative to the coordinate.
Options are
, the anchor will be dynamically adjusted to ensure the popup falls within the map container.
, the order of the popups will be dynamically rearranged to ensure that the ones anchored closer to the camera are rendered on top. Useful when showing multiple popups in a tilted map.
Callback when the user closes the popup.
Stop propagation of mouse wheel event to the map component. Can be used to stop map from zooming when this component is scrolled.
Stop propagation of dragstart event to the map component. Can be used to stop map from panning when this component is dragged.
Stop propagation of click event to the map component. Can be used to stop map from calling the
callback when this component is clicked.
Stop propagation of dblclick event to the map component. Can be used to stop map from zooming when this component is double clicked.
Like its Mapbox counterpart, this control relies on the mapbox-gl stylesheet to work properly. Make sure to add the stylesheet to your page.
